conclusion: Acceleration is the rate of change of velocity with respect to time; slope of v-t graph represents acceleration.
Velocity increases from 0 to 20 m/s from 0 to 1 second, decreases to 10 m/s from 1 to 2 seconds, and decreases to 0 m/s from 2 to 3 seconds.
Acceleration is constant at 20 m/s² from 0 to 1 second.
Acceleration is 10 m/s² from 1 to 2 seconds.
Acceleration is constant negative at -10 m/s² from 2 to 3 seconds.
Since acceleration is not constant, the particle does not undergo linear motion.
Conclude that the particle's motion is not linear as the acceleration changes over time.
